theorem P1_inter_right_of_open {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X} :
    Topology.P1 A → IsOpen (B : Set X) → Topology.P1 (A ∩ B) := by
  intro hP1A hOpenB
  -- Unfold the definition of `P1`.
  dsimp [Topology.P1] at hP1A ⊢
  -- Take an arbitrary point of `A ∩ B`.
  intro x hx
  rcases hx with ⟨hxA, hxB⟩
  -- We prove that `x` is in the closure of `interior (A ∩ B)`.
  -- We use the neighbourhood characterisation of closures.
  have : x ∈ closure (interior (A ∩ B : Set X)) := by
    -- Reformulate membership in a closure via neighbourhoods.
    apply (mem_closure_iff).2
    intro U hU_open hxU
    -- Restrict the neighbourhood to `B`, which is open.
    have hV_open : IsOpen (U ∩ B) := hU_open.inter hOpenB
    have hxV : x ∈ U ∩ B := ⟨hxU, hxB⟩
    -- `x` lies in the closure of `interior A`, hence this
    -- neighbourhood meets `interior A`.
    have hx_cl : x ∈ closure (interior (A : Set X)) := hP1A hxA
    have hInt : ((U ∩ B) ∩ interior (A : Set X)).Nonempty := by
      have h := (mem_closure_iff).1 hx_cl hV_open hxV
      -- Rearrange the intersections to a convenient form.
      simpa [Set.inter_comm, Set.inter_left_comm, Set.inter_assoc] using h
    -- Extract a witnessing point `y`.
    rcases hInt with ⟨y, ⟨hyUB, hyIntA⟩⟩
    -- The point `y` is in `U`.
    have hyU : y ∈ U := (hyUB).1
    -- The point `y` is in `B`.
    have hyB : y ∈ B := (hyUB).2
    -- We show that `y` actually belongs to `interior (A ∩ B)`.
    have hyIntAB : y ∈ interior (A ∩ B : Set X) := by
      -- Consider the open set `S = interior A ∩ B`.
      let S := interior (A : Set X) ∩ B
      have hS_open : IsOpen S := isOpen_interior.inter hOpenB
      have hyS : y ∈ S := by
        dsimp [S]
        exact And.intro hyIntA hyB
      have hS_sub : (S : Set X) ⊆ (A ∩ B : Set X) := by
        intro z hz
        rcases hz with ⟨hzIntA, hzB⟩
        exact ⟨(interior_subset hzIntA), hzB⟩
      -- `S` is an open neighbourhood of `y` contained in `A ∩ B`.
      exact (mem_interior.2 ⟨S, hS_open, hyS, hS_sub⟩)
    -- We have produced a point of `U ∩ interior (A ∩ B)`.
    exact ⟨y, ⟨hyU, hyIntAB⟩⟩
  -- Conclude the proof.
  exact this

theorem interior_closure_interior_closure_eq_self
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A : Set X} :
    interior (closure (interior (closure (A : Set X)))) =
      interior (closure (A : Set X)) := by
  -- Left‐to‐right inclusion.
  have h₁ :
      interior (closure (interior (closure (A : Set X)))) ⊆
        interior (closure (A : Set X)) := by
    -- Apply the existing monotonicity lemma to `A := closure A`.
    simpa [closure_closure] using
      (Topology.interior_closure_interior_subset_interior_closure
        (X := X) (A := closure (A : Set X)))
  -- Right‐to‐left inclusion.
  have h₂ :
      interior (closure (A : Set X)) ⊆
        interior (closure (interior (closure (A : Set X)))) :=
    Topology.interior_closure_subset_interior_closure_interior_closure
      (X := X) (A := A)
  exact Set.Subset.antisymm h₁ h₂
